column4: so nobody has any idea of how to even get a valid error message out of sshd ?
can anyone even read me ?
thanks, thats something at least
im not saying ssh stopped working on every machine in the world when i put that line in :p
then the only advice anyone can give you is: reboot, then write it down, then come back and tell us
i dont, i just get the regular login

hi, im trying to add a chroot'ed sftp thingy by following the advice of various websites to put something like this in /etc/ssh/sshd_config: "Match group sftpjail ChrootDirectory /home/specialjailhome ForceCommand internal-sftp", however, when i do that, ALL my ssh stuff breaks, even basic login, no error message in any of the logs other than the pointless: Oct 19 23:11:40 Ubuntu-1004-lucid-64-minimal
init: ssh main process (22599) terminated with status 255 Oct 19 23:11:40 Ubuntu-1004-lucid-64-minimal init: ssh respawning too fast, stopped, any idea ?
did that all get through ?
looks like it did, though your pointless log msg on 1st line may have got trimmed
Oct 19 23:11:40 Ubuntu-1004-lucid-64-minimal init: ssh main process (22599) terminated with status 255 Oct 19 23:11:40 Ubuntu-1004-lucid-64-minimal init: ssh respawning too fast, stopped
sorry I'd have little insight into what would cause such errors; just pointing out what got through :/
ah ok, thanks anyways
i guess its just a bug in ubuntu, the same line works fine on normal debians
debians using the same kernel as your oneiric counterpart?
i dont even know that word
oh, i mean 11.10 release
i run 10.04 lts
lucid, then, I run lucid too
in any case the principle still applies; your difficulty may relate to a given version of linux, distinct from what the distro does with it
possible
but i see other people with 10 lts complaining it doesnt work for them either
maybe you can find some backported version of the sshd package then?
